message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is safe to use in pregnancy and it is recommended as a prophylactic drug against malaria in pregnancy. Doxycycline is not safe to use in pregnancy as it can cause skeletal and dental abnormalities in the developing fetus. Primaquine and proguanil are also not recommended in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is safe to use in pregnancy and is recommended for prophylaxis against malaria in areas with chloroquine-resistant strains, such as Mozambique. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy and Primaquine and Proguanil are not recommended for prophylaxis during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Mefloquine is the most suitable drug for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria in pregnancy. Doxycycline is not recommended in pregnancy, Primaquine can cause hemolysis in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency, and Proguanil must be used in combination with other drugs for greater efficacy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Malaria prophylaxis is commonly done in pregnant women. Among the options, mefloquine is considered safe for use during pregnancy and is suitable for prophylaxis against malaria. Doxycycline is also effective against malaria but may cause harm to the fetus. Primaquine and proguanil are not recommended during pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is the most suitable drug for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria in pregnancy. Doxycycline is not recommended in pregnancy, primaquine has the risk of hemolytic anemia in patients with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency and proguanil has limited efficacy against some strains of malaria.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is the drug of choice for malaria prophylaxis during pregnancy, especially in the second and third trimesters. Doxycycline is contraindicated during pregnancy and Primaquine can cause hemolysis in individuals with G6PD deficiency. Proguanil is not used alone as prophylaxis due to widespread resistance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is the most suitable drug for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria in pregnant women. Doxycycline may cause discoloration of developing teeth and bones in infants, and Primaquine is contraindicated in pregnancy. Proguanil is not recommended for malaria prophylaxis in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, mefloquine is the most suitable drug for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria in pregnant women because it has been found to be safe for use during pregnancy. Doxycycline is not recommended during pregnancy, primaquine is not effective against the malaria parasites prevalent in Mozambique, and there is limited data on the safety of proguanil in pregnancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is the most suitable drug for pre-exposure prophylaxis against malaria in pregnancy. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy and Primaquine is not used for prophylaxis. Proguanil is not recommended as monotherapy in areas of multiple drug resistance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mefloquine is a safe and effective choice for malaria prophylaxis in pregnant women, making it the best option for this patient. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy and Primaquine and Proguanil have limited safety data in pregnant women.
